1.text: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is riotous; And whosoever reeleth thereby is not wise.

2.text: The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion: He that provoketh him to anger forfeiteth his life.

3.text: It is an honour for a man to keep aloof from strife; But every fool will be snarling.

4.text: The sluggard will not plow when winter setteth in; Therefore he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.

5.text: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; But a man of understanding will draw it out.

6.text: Most men will proclaim every one his own goodness; But a faithful man who can find?

7.text: He that walketh in his integrity as a just man, Happy are his children after him.

8.text: A king that sitteth on the throne of judgment Scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

9.text: Who can say: ‘I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin’?

10.text: Divers weights, and divers measures, Both of them alike are abomination to the LORD.

11.text: Even a child is known by his doings, Whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

12.text: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, The LORD hath made even both of them.

13.text: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; Open thine eyes, and thou shalt have bread in plenty.

14.text: It is bad, it is bad’, saith the buyer; But when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

15.text: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies; But the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.

16.text: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger; And hold him in pledge that is surety for an alien woman.

17.text: Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man; But afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

18.text: Every purpose is established by counsel; And with good advice carry on war.

19.text: He that goeth about as a talebearer revealeth secrets; Therefore meddle not with him that openeth wide his lips.

20.text: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, His lamp shall be put out in the blackest darkness.

21.text: An estate may be gotten hastily at the beginning; But the end thereof shall not be blessed.

22.text: Say not thou: ‘I will requite evil’; Wait for the LORD, and He will save thee.

23.text: Divers weights are an abomination to the LORD; And a false balance is not good.

24.text: A man’s goings are of the LORD; How then can man look to his way?

25.text: It is a snare to a man rashly to say: ‘Holy’, And after vows to make inquiry.

26.text: A wise king sifteth the wicked, And turneth the wheel over them.

27.text: The spirit of man is the lamp of the LORD, Searching all the inward parts.

28.text: Mercy and truth preserve the king; And his throne is upheld by mercy.

29.text: The glory of young men is their strength; And the beauty of old men is the hoary head.

30.text: Sharp wounds cleanse away evil; So do stripes that reach the inward parts.
